meanings.definition: An organism or cell produced asexually from one ancestor or parent.
meanings.sent1: The scientist created a clone of the plant by taking a cutting and growing it separately.
meanings.sent2: The clone of the sheep was genetically identical to its parent.
meanings.sent3: The clone of the apple tree decided to start its own orchard.
meanings.sent4: The clone of the virus spread rapidly through the population.
meanings.sent5: The clone of the starfish had the same regenerative abilities.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that duplicates or closely resembles another.
meanings.sent1: The identical twin was often mistaken for a clone of his brother.
meanings.sent2: The new smartphone was a clone of the popular model from last year.
meanings.sent3: The clone of the superhero costume was not as impressive as the original.
meanings.sent4: The counterfeit handbag was a clone of the designer brand.
meanings.sent5: The robot was a perfect clone of its human creator.
